page.title: 10Recreation in the villages
page.content: The nearest{cinema}is in Wigston, but those who go regularly prefer the wider choice in Leicester.{Theatre goers also choose Leicester,although some travel to London and Stratford- upon-Avon,or watch amateur productions at Market Harborough. Only a few villagers have no annual {holiday}and of those who do, 50% take it in this country,25% go abroad and 25% have a foreign and a British holiday. The countryside is widely used for walking,cycling and horse-riding,and fox-hunting is well supported, especially in Laughton.The local hunt is the Fernie.There are about 20 horses in the area,60 dogs,50 cats and a few rabbits,hamsters,birds,donkeys, ducks,Guinea pigs and rats.About a quarter of the people do not own a pet.
